phrases: It is like you are going over there to strangle an old, senile dog.
It kind of makes you worry.
I thought in a situation like this, maybe you are the type to throw the match.
Because you are such a nice guy.
He became a professional at 25 years old, so he has 40 years of experience.
At his best, he was in Rank B-1 for one term.
I have spotted him many times at the Shogi Hall.
I saw the back of a small statured man who always walked briskly.
I said it out loud, but I could not imagine it.
That is over twice as long as I have been alive.
On this 81-square board, he is lived and died over and over.
I hear if Mr. Matsunaga is demoted to C-2, he will finally retire.
I wonder how he feels right now.
God, to be honest, I just want to go home.
But please somehow let me win!
True, I did not imagine that.
Now he is drawing a fortune paper!
Oh no, he looks super depressed!
You should not even draw a fortune slip at a time like this!
I need to get to the table, calm down, and wait for him.
Feels like he saw something he should not have
D-Do not tell me he really did go home...
Some kind of veteran player strategy?
What will my life be like in 40 years?
Surrounds himself, and then he means to have a long, careful battle?
That keeps the king pinned down so I can attack whenever I need to.
He is not doing Bear in the Castle?
I cannot tell what his strategy is.
So he is doing Bear in the Castle after all?
I think he is just trying to confuse me?
He has some kind of plan, right?
The calm mind is the way.
All right, it is in there.
Did he just make a weird noise?
Wait a minute, he was not thinking about it?
And I can see someone behind him!
If you move now, you will be in trouble, Mr. Bear!
For some reason, it is very painful.
The king and rook are in check.
But if I place the bishop there, he will match it at 5-e, and then a 3-f-Knight...
This is seriously painful for some reason.
I have never felt like this.
It would be difficult to lose on purpose, even if I wanted to!
It kind of makes you worry.
Because you are such a nice guy.
Such a nice guy, such a nice guy, such a nice guy...
I am grateful you said that about me, but...
I do not think I am nice at all.
I am from the pressure-free generation, with no patience!
Choose a strategy Take Care of Your Life Let us Go Go Attack
Shogi players must never do this.
Where is the dignity of 40 years of professional shogi?
I mean, even as a human being, what is this?
Are you sure you want to go out this way?
At least, make me respect you!
Let us hurry and go home!
I do not want to wait together for the elevator with him,
so I will dash down the stairs!
Apparently was thinking the same thing
Let us get you to a doctor.
It was just a small trip.
This is why you youngsters are so pathetic.
But you said you nearly died!
I do not want to see your face
But you just told me to get lost!
You have got the money, do not you?
The famous Mr. Miyanogawa does not disappoint!
It is hot and tender to the core!
If you want to be first-class, you got to start by eating first-class food.
Well, I am paying for this.
Do not be such a stiff.
Not a single drop of emotion.
You are ruining the taste of my beer!
Well, Kouda is your foster parent.
He was also a prize pupil, really strong, but no personality whatsoever.
Come to think of it, he is got that daughter, too.
Strong-willed, with a face as beautiful as the devil.
When she becomes an adult, just you wait.
She will become a poisonous woman.
Living under a roof with that kind of person, I bet you got tormented by her.
But, y'know, all women are scary.
You should meet my wife, sheesh...
It is makin' the booze go bad.
They have got Soul of Aizu!
Do you know about Soul of Aizu?
It is sake from my hometown, Aizu.
But we are aware of our surroundings and emphasize etiquette.
They are clueless about the soul of the true Fukushima!
Let us go back to the year 1643.
recognized a minor feudal lord with just 30,000 koku
for his shrewdness and stern honesty.
He was granted an extremely generous 230,000 koku and became
the first-generation feudal lord of Aizu.
He was a truly wise ruler!
Masayuki was not only an administrator, but was made the adjunct
to the fourth Tokugawa shogun, Ietsuna.
As the center of the shogunate administration, he set forth a number of policies.
In order to provide the residents of Edo with drinking water,
he created the Tamagawa water supply river works.
To prevent neighboring dwellings from burning in a fire,
he widened streets from six to ten ken, and established main streets in Ueno as a firebreak.
When a plan to rebuild the tower of the burnt down Edo Castle came up,
Peace reigns in the land, so it is unnecessary.
He is the pride of Aizu!
And do you know the pension system?
It is said Masayuki devised that, too.
To prepare for a famine, he laid down a law
stating that rice be stored in granaries as well as distributed for free to elderly people
aged 90 or older, whatever their social status.
It is said that our pension system today is based on that.
Masayuki, who stressed welfare of the people, had a spirit flowing with genuine benevolence
that even now supports the sincere hearts of Fukushima Prefecture citizens today!
Now let us leap forward 250 years, to the Boshin War...
But before that, I will have another Soul of Aizu!
and boy is he a handful...
What happened to the Boshin War?
Still a child, so not accustomed to the behaviors of a drunk
What happened to the talk about the souls of people from Fukushima?
All right, let us go to the next place!
He is the exact image of a drunk.
Did you just say another place?
Besides, I am out of money!
What kind of winner says I am going home first?
I will pay for the next one.
Seems the booze goes straight to my legs these days.
The arm of a man who is grasped nothing but shogi pieces for 40 years.
I hear Mr. Matsunaga will finally retire.
I had a feeling I could not win.
I had a feeling I would not be able to win at all.
All I thought about on the way to the hall was How can I look cool losing?
You probably did not know me, but I know a lot about you.
After all, you are the fifth middle school student who became a professional.
I have held fast to the shogi board for 40 years without any records to show for it,
so to me, your existence was something bright and frustrating.
I could only think of you as the Grim Reaper,
come to close the curtain on my life as a shogi player.
I was frightened of you, and then disgusted with myself for feeling that way.
But then, the instant I saw you sitting up straight in the match room,
Such a young, beautiful Grim Reaper.
If someone was going to close the curtain, I could not ask for anyone better.
I thought I would at least fight fair and square once more before fading away.
I do not want to die!
Here I was at the end of my long career, muddying my legacy, struggling pathetically,
and one thought welled up from within.
I do not want to lose.
Even still, I do not want to lose.
That was my crazed line of thought.
How the hell would I know?
When I win, I would be so happy, that I would want to shout with joy.
When I lose, it is agonizing, like somebody trampled my innards with muddy boots.
I would feel tormented, from everyone saying that I do not deserve to be alive.
And yet, I could not quit.
How can I even express it in words?!
I figured you would be depressed, so I thought I could cheer you up.
It is a match, after all.
Mr. Matsunaga is not going to quit.
He is going to keep playing shogi.
Would you help me convince my wife and daughter?
That I have decided not to retire after all.
They must be worried about you.
Shogi players do need physical strength.
I do not want to quit.
All this time, I have never helped with chores, saying I needed to focus on shogi.
If I quit now, I know exactly how my family will take their revenge!
My blood runs cold just thinking about it!
So from now on, you are doing your share of the housework.
I cannot wait to train you!
They will make me wash dishes and my grandson, too!
Do not wait until you retire.
Do not say I do not want to!
Family members should help each other!
You want me to teach you how to do chores?
No matter what anyone says, I definitely
When did Christmas become painful for me?
Hey, Dad, can I open it now?
I wonder which would be more fitting for their last Christmas together.
March Comes in Like a Lion.
You will not watch it next time?
